DialogHook.synopsis: Confrontation with Florrick if Ravengard died. Wyll is not present.
DialogHook.how_to_trigger: - Kill Ravengard;- Go to 33; 35; -41 without Wyll

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM.synopsis: Confrontation with Florrick if Ravengard died.
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM.how_to_trigger: - Kill Ravengard;- Go to 33; 35; -41;OR- Use origin debug book to go to Wyll's Act3 moments;- Florrick Confrontation;

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM.synopsis: Confrontation with Florrick if Ravengard died.
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM.how_to_trigger: - Kill Ravengard;- Go to 33; 35; -41;OR- Use origin debug book to go to Wyll's Act3 moments;- Florrick Confrontation;

DialogHook_63.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_63.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick appears with a cadre of allies from the upper city - patriars and their guards.

DialogHook_50.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_50.text: The Blade of Frontiers - all pomp and empty oaths. The Sword Coast's most dashing fraud.
DialogHook_50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick spits on the ground in front of Wyll before addressing him. He is taken aback.NodeContext: Include Florrick Spitting before saying line.

DialogHook_46.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_46.text: You are either a fool for trusting him - or a wretch for conspiring with him. It doesn't matter which.

DialogHook_73.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_73.text: Lady Mizora told me everything. How Wyll slaughtered his own father, how he craves his power.

DialogHook_16.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_16.text: How he means to make the city bow to him and him alone.

DialogHook_26.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_26.text: This city holds no place for you - or for Ravengard's treacherous spawn.
DialogHook_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick and her allies ready for battle.

DialogHook_66.speaker: Player
DialogHook_66.text: Zariel's stunt destroyed countless lives. Mizora is her minion - you can't trust her.

DialogHook_36.speaker: Player
DialogHook_36.text: The Blade has saved countless lives. He is still the man you thought he was.

DialogHook_75.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

DialogHook_1.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_1.text: By the living gods, I believe you.

DialogHook_4.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_4.text: What darkness has fallen upon us.

DialogHook_79.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_79.text: There's something you must know. I should've told Wyll sooner, but I'd hoped somehow Ravengard would return to us.

DialogHook_64.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_64.text: He knew about the Absolute. I thought little of it at first - but he realised the danger before anyone else did.

DialogHook_78.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_78.text: He understood that if the cult were successful in raising an army, Baldur's Gate would be doomed.

DialogHook_29.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_29.text: Before the Absolutists abducted him, he told me that should he fall, I should seek Wyll out and give him a message.

DialogHook_44.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_44.text: Wyll was schooled in the ways of the great champions. He is to use those lessons to wake the wyrm sleeping beneath Baldur's Gate. The wyrm is oathbound to answer the call and come to the city's aid.

DialogHook_59.speaker: Player
DialogHook_59.text: A wyrm? Are you saying there's a dragon living under the city?

DialogHook_49.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_49.text: A bronze dragon, yes. He sleeps beneath us even now, awaiting a hero to rouse him.

DialogHook_12.speaker: Player
DialogHook_12.text: Do you know what these lessons are?

DialogHook_19.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_19.text: No. But I know only a true champion can awaken the wyrm. I thought only Ulder could succeed. With his death, the duty falls to his son.

DialogHook_8.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_8.text: The wyrm goes by many names. Ansur. The Waiting Storm. The Heart of the Gate.

DialogHook_10.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_10.text: He promised Balduran he'd protect the city if ever its existence was threatened - but just the once.

DialogHook_55.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_55.text: The city has faced countless threats. But Ravengard knew it could not survive the Absolute's slaughter.

DialogHook_18.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_18.text: With him gone and the city near ruin, the wyrm's awakening now falls to you and Wyll.

DialogHook_20.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_20.text: The duke gave me this - 'The Legend of Ansur'. An ancient epic, ill-remembered, dismissed as a mere tale.

DialogHook_31.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_31.text: Let it set the path before you. Or do not, and see Baldur's Gate burn to ash.

DialogHook_37.speaker: Player
DialogHook_37.text: The dragon Ansur is dead, Florrick.

DialogHook_30.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_30.text: We need to prepare for battle. I will head out and seek out more allies to help our cause.

DialogHook_45.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_45.text: The fate of the city now rests with us.

DialogHook_38.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_38.text: Have courage. May we drive the Absolute forever from the Coast.

DialogHook_69.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_69.text: Dead. So once more, fortune turns against us.

DialogHook_57.speaker: Player
DialogHook_57.text: Your faith is well-founded. I will take your message to Wyll.

DialogHook_23.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_23.text: Thank you. In darkness, I see your light.

DialogHook_22.speaker: Player
DialogHook_22.text: Please. You're staking the city's future on a fairy tale.

DialogHook_7.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_7.text: A history told by Balduran himself, stretching a thousand years back. It is no fable - it is plain truth.

DialogHook_17.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_17.text: I should go. I know of still others that might help us when the battle horns call.

DialogHook_2.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_2.text: Unleash the wyrm, let his tempest swallow the Absolute and its allies. And may they be driven forever from the Coast.

DialogHook_33.speaker: Player
DialogHook_33.text: Let the dragon sleep. I'll deal with the Absolute on my own terms.

DialogHook_58.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_58.text: Even Baldur's Gate's greatest warrior knew when to contain the storm and when to release it.

DialogHook_56.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_56.text: That warrior was Ravengard. If you prize his ways, you'll help Wyll seek out the wyrm.

DialogHook_76.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_76.text: There is a tome - 'The Legend of Ansur'. An ancient epic, ill-remembered, dismissed as a mere tale.

DialogHook_9.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_9.text: I once carried it, but it was stolen from me. Find it, let it set the path before you. Or do not, and see your home burn to ash.

DialogHook_24.speaker: Player
DialogHook_24.text: The city has found its protector, thank you very much. Me.

DialogHook_28.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_28.text: Only a true champion can awaken the wyrm. As the Blade of Frontiers, Wyll has proven his worth. Please - take him this message.

DialogHook_52.speaker: Player
DialogHook_52.text: Ravengard could still be alive. And we intend to save him.

DialogHook_60.speaker: Player
DialogHook_60.text: Ravengard's death was Gortash's doing. There was nothing we could do.

DialogHook_43.speaker: Player
DialogHook_43.text: Mizora lied to you. We tried to save Ravengard, and she sabotaged us.

DialogHook_13.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_13.text: How easily the lies fall from your tongue.

DialogHook_61.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_61.text: Your fate is set. You will pay the price of Ulder Ravengard's death!

DialogHook_34.speaker: Player
DialogHook_34.text: A relevant thread of knowledge pokes at your mind. Explore it.

DialogHook_0.speaker: Narrator
DialogHook_0.text: *You remember the stories of Elturel's fall. The city was dragged into the Hells at Zariel's behest - and Ravengard along with it.*

DialogHook_3.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_3.text: The Blade of Frontiers, hero of the Sword Coast - and his own father's killer. I can barely believe it.

DialogHook_41.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_41.text: My thoughts are not for you to know. To arms, champions!

DialogHook_47.speaker: Player
DialogHook_47.text: When we found you in prison, you'd given up. Who's the hypocrite here?

DialogHook_77.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_77.text: Yet I came through, I did what was right. You butchered Ulder like the devils you are.

DialogHook_35.speaker: Player
DialogHook_35.text: Attack us, then. Let's see who's left standing.

DialogHook_53.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DialogHook_53.text: Then your fate is set. You will pay the price of Ulder Ravengard's death!

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_11.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_11.text: I thought you were going to save him, but you abused his current state to get rid of him!

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_62.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_62.text: As long as I breathe, you will not take another step in this city!

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_61.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_61.text: Zariel's stunt destroyed countless lives. Mizora is her minion - you can't trust her.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_92.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_92.text: I have saved countless lives. I am still the man you thought I was.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_84.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_84.text: On my honour, father's still alive. And I intend to save him.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_110.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_110.text: Father's death was Gortash's doing. There was nothing I could do.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_9.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_9.text: Mizora lied to you. I wanted to save my father, and the devil sabotaged me.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_40.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_40.text: Are you saying there's a dragon living under the city?

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_105.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_105.text: A bronze dragon, yes. He sleeps beneath us even now, awaiting a hero to rouse him.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_42.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_42.text: The wyrm goes by many names. Ansur. The Waiting Storm. The Heart of the Gate.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_36.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_36.text: He promised Balduran he'd protect the city if ever its existence was threatened. But just the once.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_127.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_127.text: Since then the city faced countless threats - but the Baldurians overcame them all. There was never any need to call upon the wyrm. But this time, things are different.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_81.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_81.text: This is the greatest threat Baldur's Gate ever faced. Your father was right - We need Ansur's help. With him gone, the wyrm's awakening now falls to you.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_122.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_122.text: The duke gave me this - 'The Legend of Ansur'. An ancient epic, ill-remembered, dismissed as a mere tale.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_116.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_116.text: Let it set the path before you.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_0.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_0.text: The dragon Ansur is dead, Florrick.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_22.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_22.text: We need to prepare for battle. I will head out and seek out more allies to help our cause.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_26.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_26.text: The fate of the city now rests with us.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_97.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_97.text: May your father's courage be with you, Wyll. And may we drive the Absolute forever from the Coast.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_24.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_24.text: Dead. So once more, fortune turns against us.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_31.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_31.text: We need to prepare for battle. I will head out and seek out more allies to help our cause.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_12.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_12.text: Your faith in me is well-founded. I will seek the wyrm and ask for his help.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_103.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_103.text: Thank you. In darkness, I see your light.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_129.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_129.text: Please. You're staking the city's future on a fairy tale.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_39.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_39.text: A history told by Balduran himself, stretching a thousand years back. It is no fable - it is plain truth.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_88.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_88.text: Let the dragon sleep. I'll deal with the Absolute on my own terms.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_67.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_67.text: Even Baldur's Gate's greatest warrior knew when to contain the storm and when to release it.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_30.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_30.text: That warrior was your father, Wyll. If you prize his ways, you'll seek out the wyrm.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_17.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_17.text: I will go and assemble any allies I can find. When the battle horns call, we'll stand ready.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_50.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_50.text: Unleash the wyrm, Wyll - let his tempest swallow the Absolute and its allies. Good luck!

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_6.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_6.text: There is a tome - 'The Legend of Ansur'. An ancient epic, ill-remembered, dismissed as a mere tale.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_19.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_19.text: Your father gave it to me, but it was stolen. Find it, let it set the path before you.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_135.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_135.text: Courage. Insight. Strategy. Justice. Each of them will soon be put to the test.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_78.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_78.text: Waking a dragon doesn't sound like a good idea.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_21.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_21.text: How easily the lies fall from your tongue.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_99.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_99.text: Your fate is set. You will pay the price of Ulder Ravengard's death!

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_51.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_51.text: A relevant thread of knowledge pokes at your mind. Explore it.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_112.speaker: Narrator
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_112.text: *The stories of Elturel's fall come to mind. The city was dragged into the Hells at Zariel's behest - and your father along with it. He knew all too well how infernal machinations worked.*

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_87.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_87.text: The Blade of Frontiers, hero of the Sword Coast - and his own father's killer. I can barely believe it.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_108.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_108.text: My thoughts are not for you to know. To arms, champions!

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_52.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_52.text: When you were holed up in Wyrm's Rock, you'd given up. Who's the hypocrite here?

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_8.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_8.text: Yet I came through, I did what was right. You butchered your father like the devil you are.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_46.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_46.text: Well played, Florrick. But you will not stand in my way - the city is mine by rights.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_80.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_80.text: Your fate is set. You will pay the price of Ulder Ravengard's death!

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_71.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick appears with a cadre of allies from the upper city - patriars and their guards.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_34.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_34.text: The Blade of Frontiers - all pomp and empty oaths. The Sword Coast's most dashing fraud.
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick spits on the ground in front of Wyll before addressing him. He is taken aback.NodeContext: Please include Florricking Spitting (motion and sound) before delivering the line.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_101.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_101.text: I trusted you. I believed in you.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_32.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_32.text: Florrick, what are you on about - what is this?

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_77.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_77.text: Lady Mizora told me everything. How you slaughtered your own father, how you crave his power.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_70.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_70.text: You mean to make the city bow to you and you alone!

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_113.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_113.text: Save it. My duty is to Baldur's Gate - and it holds no place for Ravengard's treacherous spawn.
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_113.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick and her allies ready for battle.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_1.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_1.text: On my honour, father's still alive. And I intend to save him.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_120.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_120.text: Father's death was Gortash's doing. There was nothing I could do!

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_68.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_68.text: She lied to you, Florrick. I did everything in my power to get my father to safety!

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_76.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_76.text: How easily the lies fall from your tongue.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_4.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_4.text: Florrick. Mizora is a devil; I am my father's son. Will you really trust her word over mine?

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_3.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_102.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_102.text: By the living gods, I believe you.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_15.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_15.text: What darkness has fallen upon us.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_13.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_13.text: Wyll, there's something you must know. I should've told you sooner, but I'd hoped somehow your father would return to us.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_98.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_98.text: He knew about the Absolute. I thought little of it at first - but he realised the danger before anyone else did.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_96.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_96.text: He understood that if the cult were successful in raising an army, Baldur's Gate would be doomed.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_85.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_85.text: Before the Absolutists abducted him, he told me that should he fall, I must seek you out and give you this message.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_10.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_10.text: Your father trained you in the ways of the great champions. You are to use those lessons to wake the wyrm under the city. He is oathbound to answer your call and come to our aid.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_33.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_33.text: Do you mean Ansur? He's naught but bones, Florrick. But his spirit has blessed me with power.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_74.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_74.text: Do you mean Ansur? The dragon is dead.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_7.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_7.text: A wyrm? Do you mean there's a dragon living under the city?

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_55.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_55.text: It will be done. I will seek the wyrm. Together, we will strike down the Absolute.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_90.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_90.text: Ravengard's blood courses through your veins. Your father would be proud.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_38.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_38.text: Florrick. I am my father's son. You know me. Will you really trust the word of a devil over mine?

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_57.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_57.text: I swear I did everything I could to save him. I swear it by all I hold dear.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_50.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick appears with a cadre of allies from the upper city - patriars and their guards.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_29.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_29.text: The Blade of Frontiers - all pomp and empty oaths. The Sword Coast's most dashing fraud.
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick spits on the ground in front of Wyll before addressing him. He is taken aback.NodeContext: Please include Florricking Spitting (motion and sound) before delivering the line.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_72.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_72.text: I trusted you. I believed in you.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_28.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_28.text: Florrick, what are you on about - what is this?

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_55.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_55.text: Lady Mizora told me everything. How you slaughtered your own father, how you crave his power.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_7.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_7.text: I thought you were going to save him, but you abused his current state to get rid of him!

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_49.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_49.text: You mean to make the city bow to you and you alone!

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_79.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_79.text: Save it. My duty is to Baldur's Gate - and it holds no place for Ravengard's treacherous spawn.
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_79.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick and her allies ready for battle.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_22.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_22.text: Zariel's stunt destroyed countless lives. Mizora is her minion - you can't trust her.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_0.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_0.text: The Blade has saved countless lives. He is still the man you thought he was.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_32.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_32.text: Florrick. I am my father's son. You know me. Will you really trust the word of a devil over mine?

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_42.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_42.text: I swear I did everything I could to save him. I swear it by all I hold dear.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_3.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_73.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_73.text: By the living gods, I believe you.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_9.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_9.text: What darkness has fallen upon us.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_8.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_8.text: Wyll, there's something you must know. I should've told you sooner, but I'd hoped somehow your father would return to us.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_71.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_71.text: He knew about the Absolute. I thought little of it at first - but he realised the danger before anyone else did.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_69.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_69.text: He understood that if the cult were successful in raising an army, Baldur's Gate would be doomed.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_62.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_62.text: Before the Absolutists abducted him, he told me that should he fall, I must seek you out and give you this message.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_5.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_5.text: Your father trained you in the ways of the great champions. You are to use those lessons to wake the wyrm under the city. He is oathbound to answer your call and come to our aid.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_64.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_64.text: A wyrm? Are you saying there's a dragon living under the city?

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_75.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_75.text: A bronze dragon, yes. He sleeps beneath us even now, awaiting a hero to rouse him.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_61.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_61.text: Courage. Insight. Strategy. Justice. I remember them well. Father made me recite them every morning.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_19.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_19.text: I would like to know more about this wyrm.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_36.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_36.text: The wyrm goes by many names. Ansur. The Waiting Storm. The Heart of the Gate.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_30.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_30.text: He promised Balduran he'd protect the city if ever its existence was threatened. But just the once.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_87.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_87.text: Since then the city faced countless threats - but the Baldurians overcame them all. There was never any need to call upon the wyrm. But this time, things are different.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_60.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_60.text: This is the greatest threat Baldur's Gate ever faced. Your father was right - we need Ansur's help. With him gone, the wyrm's awakening now falls to you.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_83.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_83.text: The duke gave me this - 'The Legend of Ansur'. An ancient epic, ill-remembered, dismissed as a mere tale.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_80.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_80.text: Let it set the path before you.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_34.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_34.text: The dragon Ansur is dead, Florrick.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_13.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_13.text: We need to prepare for battle. I will head out and seek out more allies to help our cause.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_20.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_20.text: The fate of the city now rests with us.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_70.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_70.text: May your father's courage be with you, Wyll. And may we drive the Absolute forever from the Coast.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_17.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_17.text: Dead. So once more, fortune turns against us.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_27.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_27.text: We need to prepare for battle. I will head out and seek out more allies to help our cause.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_65.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_65.text: Your faith in Wyll is well-founded. We will seek the wyrm and ask for his help.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_74.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_74.text: Thank you. In darkness, I see your light.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_43.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_43.text: You're going to trust him? You do know he made a pact with a devil, right?

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_1.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_1.text: Ravengard blood runs through Wyll's veins. I choose to trust. I hope you choose to honour it.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_10.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_10.text: I will go and assemble any allies I can find. When the battle horns call, we'll stand ready.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_38.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_38.text: Unleash the wyrm, Wyll - let his tempest swallow the Absolute and its allies. Good luck!

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_35.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_35.text: Wyll? What do you make of this?

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_6.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_6.text: Baldur's Gate stands on the brink of the abyss. Let's awaken the wyrm, and take back the city.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_66.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_66.text: Ravengard's blood courses through your veins. Your father would be proud.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_14.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_14.text: Please. You're staking the city's future on a fairy tale.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_33.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_33.text: A history told by Balduran himself, stretching a thousand years back. It is no fable - it is plain truth.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_68.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_68.text: Let the dragon sleep. We'll deal with the Absolute on our own terms.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_45.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_45.text: Even Baldur's Gate's greatest warrior knew when to contain the storm and when to release it.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_23.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_23.text: That warrior was your father, Wyll. If you prize his ways, you'll seek out the wyrm.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_4.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_4.text: There is a tome - 'The Legend of Ansur'. An ancient epic, ill-remembered, dismissed as a mere tale.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_11.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_11.text: Your father gave it to me, but it was stolen. Find it, let it set the path before you.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_39.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_39.text: Waking a dragon doesn't sound like a good idea.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_24.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_24.text: Ravengard could still be alive. And we intend to save him.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_12.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_12.text: Ravengard's death was Gortash's doing. There was nothing we could do.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_90.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_90.text: Mizora lied to you. We tried to save Ravengard, and she sabotaged us.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_46.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_46.text: It's true, Florrick. You can't believe her. She's a devil. Will you really trust her word over mine?

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_53.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_53.text: How easily the lies fall from your tongue.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_59.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_59.text: Your fate is set. You will pay the price of Ulder Ravengard's death!

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_67.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_67.text: A relevant thread of knowledge pokes at your mind. Explore it.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_81.speaker: Narrator
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_81.text: *You remember the stories of Elturel's fall. The city was dragged into the Hells at Zariel's behest - and Ravengard along with it.*

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_18.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_18.text: The Blade of Frontiers, hero of the Sword Coast - and his own father's killer. I can barely believe it.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_77.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_77.text: My thoughts are not for you to know. To arms, champions!

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_63.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_63.text: When we found you in prison, you'd given up. Who's the hypocrite here?

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_44.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_44.text: Yet I came through, I did what was right. You butchered Ulder like the devils you are.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_47.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_47.text: Attack us, then. Let's see who's left standing.

OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_52.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
OM_Wyll_AOM_COM_OOM_52.text: Then your fate is set. You will pay the price of Ulder Ravengard's death!
